title: Can filmmakers basically make an almost sure chance that a movie gets a sequel before it's even released? - Quora

response.answer_text: Sometimes, as with James Cameron's in-the-works Avatar movies or Peter Jackson's Lord of the Rings trilogy, sequels are greenlighted in advance. Otherwise, the closest to thing to a guaranteed sequel is when a bestselling book series is adapted. In such cases sequels are tentatively planned, but can still be cancelled if the first film tanks at the box office.
